cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 240 mi SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Marco is moving north-northwest but is forecast to bend northwest then west-northwest, skirting the Louisiana coast Monday before drifting west inland toward southeast Texas by mid-week.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch Sabine Pass TX to Morgan City LA; Hurricane Watch Intracoastal City LA to west of Morgan City; Tropical Storm Watch MS/AL border to AL/FL border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Morgan City LA to Mouth of Pearl River; Tropical Storm Warning Cameron LA to west of Morgan City and Mouth of Pearl River to MS/AL border; Storm Surge Warning Morgan City LA to Ocean Springs MS including Lake Borgne
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas across Louisiana to coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 mph) possible late Tuesday night into Wednesday as the weakening system drifts west of Louisiana.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water-level rises of 1–2 ft possible along the upper Texas coast; significant surge (>3 ft) is not expected at Texas City.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Wednesday with locally higher amounts in bands, which could cause brief ponding on terminal areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the upper Texas coast through mid-week.
